name: MO17 Hotel Boutique

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked one night at the hotel on short notice based upon information in internet. Although in a very old building in the historical centre, the inside of the hotel is top modern. A very small hotel, as the designation "boutique hotel" suggests with very friendly and helpful personnel. Beside the remarkable design, the small room with high ceiling was equipped with all kind of electronic devices. Otherwise, there are no "frills". Anyhow the room was situated in the basement directly adjacent to the Melchor Ocampo street , but the window absorbed almost all noise from the street, and there is not much traffic. Room was very tidy and clean. It might be embarrassing that the bathroom including toilet is open and somehow quite indiscrete. The king-size bed was extremely comfortable but small for two persons. It needs some expertise to switch on the television, CNN is available but BBC not, the hotel receptionist was really helpful to switch on the TV. All the utilities worked without exception, the water pressure of tap was remarkably high. The light concept in the room was impressive. As smoking not allowed in room, had to go outside - that was a bit a hassle.There is no restaurant, but breakfast is served in an almost private atmosphere on the rooftop terrace in a relaxing atmosphere. The location is superb, as in midst of historical centre but still quiet. We travelled per bus, so no need for parking. It didn't look as if there was much parking space in the vicinity. Choosing this hotel means you get a state of the art design room with immaculate utilities, but there is nothing to remind you that you are in an old Mexican city, except the view from the terrace.
reviews.title: Unique Place

reviews.text: It was my very first time in a boutique hotel and it was a great experience. The hotel is located just few blocks from Queretaro's downtown, so we walk a little bit to do some window shopping and have great food. The rooms are well equipped and very spacious. I loved the architecture, for me it was a mix between modern and romantic, our staying was unforgettable.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel in Queretaro downtown

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I only stayed one night in this place and the things that I liked the most is the design and the location of the hotel. The design follows the latest trends giving a fresh and unique style to the hotel that is located on the middle of dowtown. The location is excellent, no need of car if you are going to historic center, it took us a 5 minute walk to get there.
reviews.title: Nice concept and perfect location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only thing that I notice is that the design may be to trendy or vanguardist for some people - There is no door between bathroom and room, everything is open. For me was OK because I was going with my wife, but maybe for some people may be an issue. They have a room for families were the bathroom has a door, so if you have an issue with everything open ask for that room.
reviews.title: Excellent combination of design, comfort and service.

description: Redefining lodging in Queretaro, MO17 Boutique Hotel is a cutting-edge concept where luxury, design, technology and highly personalized service merge to create a new experience.
